summary: This is an email from whistleblower Christopher J. Dilorio to SEC judges, appealing a preliminary denial of his whistleblower award. He alleges massive, ongoing securities fraud involving Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (NITE), facilitated by SEC corruption and obstruction. He details illegal naked short selling, money laundering through OTC shells, and cover-ups of financial insolvency, implicating numerous individuals and entities.

persons.context: Author of the email, alleging extensive securities fraud, SEC corruption, and obstruction related to Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu and other entities. He is appealing a denied whistleblower award.

connections.description: Dilorio repeatedly accuses Handler (with Jefferies) of being a primary beneficiary of fraud and having a corrupt, criminal relationship with the SEC.
Dilorio accuses Clayton of failing to recuse himself, not disclosing conflicts, and facilitating fraud through his former firm's connections to NITE.
Described as colleagues at Sullivan & Cromwell, with Fishman playing a key role in matters related to NITE/Virtu.
Mentioned together in the context of writing down billions in naked short fails and ongoing fraud at NITE/Virtu.
Both are described by Dilorio as 'Bag Men' involved in fraudulent schemes related to OTC shells and money laundering.
Both are SEC officials addressed together in Dilorio's emails regarding the handling of his whistleblower information and award denial.
Brothers and co-founders of SeeThruEquity, LLC, subject to an SEC complaint.

events.title: Knight Capital 'Glitch'
events.description: A trading 'glitch' at Knight Capital that caused massive losses, which the whistleblower alleges proved Knight was insolvent and was the first of many cover-ups for ongoing fraud.

events.title: Filing of Knight Capital TCR
events.description: Christopher Dilorio filed a Tip, Complaint or Referral (TCR) with SEC official Berger regarding Knight Capital, detailing alleged fraud.

events.title: VIRT/KCG Merger and Write-Down
events.description: Prior to the Virtu/KCG merger closing, the SEC, Cifu, and Handler wrote down over $4 billion in naked short fails, which were fraudulently listed as assets to inflate KCG's book value.

events.title: SEC Complaint Against SeeThruEquity
events.description: The SEC brought a complaint against SeeThruEquity, LLC and the Tandon brothers for pump-and-dump promotion, which the whistleblower links to Net Element (NETE).

events.title: Preliminary Denial of Whistleblower Award
events.description: The SEC's Office of the Whistleblower issued a preliminary denial of Christopher Dilorio's award application related to his 2013 Knight Capital TCR, which he is appealing.

events.title: Formal Appeal Submission
events.description: Christopher Dilorio sends this email with attachments as a formal appeal of the preliminary denial of his whistleblower award, detailing allegations of ongoing fraud and SEC corruption.

locations: China (mentioned as manufacturing location for Qiantu/CH-Auto)
keyFacts: The whistleblower alleges Knight Capital/KCG/Virtu (operating as NITE) is engaged in ongoing, massive illegal naked short selling of OTC shells to facilitate money laundering, constituting its core, hidden business.
He claims the SEC, including Chairman Jay Clayton, has criminally obstructed investigations, protected NITE, and facilitated fraud by approving mergers like VIRT/KCG despite evidence of insolvency.
The 2012 Knight 'glitch' and a 2017 multi-billion dollar write-down of naked short fails are presented as key events in a cover-up to perpetuate the fraud.

The whistleblower asserts his information formed the basis for several SEC and FINRA complaints (e.g., against Sason, Keener, Brown Brothers Harriman, SeeThruEquity) while the main perpetrator, NITE, was protected.

He links the fraud to other entities like Net Element (NETE), describing it as a money laundering operation connected to figures like Crede, Peizer, and Milken, and facilitated by fraudulent reverse mergers.
